intro: Nemexia herbacea, commonly known as the slender nemexia, is a low-growing, flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
